author: Jake Chapman

comment: It's disturbing and can be seen as creepy on face value. I see it as AH narcissistic love bombing JD. If you're able to keep an open mind about JD not being perfect then I'll explain myself. I think back to some of the texts that were read out at the UK trial that involved the B***h word alot and I see it as AH being edgy and tough in this letter. Even the texts between JD and Vanessa ,the way they communicated was full of swearing. It's a tone that is set up between JD and his partners, not necessarily intended to hurt, just as a way of expressing themselves. Then the timing - JD has come out of a long term relationship with Vanessa and is now in the "honeymoon" phase of a relationship with AH, where he is in a physical whirlwind with this sexually aggressive, younger, beautiful woman. How intoxicating must it be to find this perfect beauty who perfectly suits him (by her design as we found out), a woman who doesn't hesitate to demand his physicality at a time in his life that is for many men a mid life crisis point. Possibly for him he feels the rush of being in demand by this woman who could be with any other person, and she is not hesitant in letting him know that he is desired and lusted after by her. Lets face it, JD has been the recipient of many women (and men) attentions for decades so AH has to do something that will stand out and catch his attention. As for AH, well she is declaring that she has access to the world's most sexiest man and what a rush that must be. That's not even going into the other possible reasons such as fame and fortune as benefits for AH. So while this might not be your average love letter,  it is a love letter to capture the attention of a man at that moment in his life. Say what you will about AH but she studied her target and almost got everything she wanted.

comment: Want to play a fun game?  Re-read this letter as if is sent by a *man!*  "Good Afternoon *MY BELOVED Mera* woman    THIS DARK DANGEROUS PIMP    *WILL EAT*   YOU ALIVE     *I WANT.     I NEED*     GIVE ME WHAT IS MINE !!!     (I translated "Blond Texas Bitch" as a single phrase representing how Ms. Heard desires to be seen...aggressive and dangerous...it's difficult to find a male equivalent to "bitch")  I don't know about the rest of the ladies here, but this is *not* a letter that I would appreciate getting from someone that I loved.  Just like Ms. Heard's sexy video calling Mr. Deep "my fun" just makes me feel as though she wants to "play games...(she couldn't have gone with "my desire", or even "my obsession"?)  This letter is nothing but red flags.  Using the name of a character he plays instead of his own name, and then making it even further removed from who he is by adding his gender, makes me wonder if she had taken any time to actually *know* him...or if she even *wanted* to know him.  If he was just a means to an end, it would be easier if she did not involve too much of herself in the relationship.  The rest just reads like a threat.  In a romantic letter, it is more personal to devote your love to your beloved.  "My heart, my desire is yours."  *NOT*  "You are mine."  She might as well have written "You are mine, to do with as I want.  You have *no say* in the matter!!!"
